image.altText: A close-up photo of a man with blue eyes, wearing a light-coloured shirt as he walks out of court.

props.synopsis: The jury in Matt Wright's criminal trial has heard he was not on the fatal crocodile egg-collecting mission because he was barred from remote Arnhem Land as he was an "anti-vaxxer". Follow live.

title.children: Pilot 'knew something wasn't right' when TV star visited him in hospital

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: A string of regulatory failings saw a Victorian childcare worker retain a legal clearance to work with children — despite being blacklisted from the industry after an investigation found he was grooming toddlers.

title.children: Childcare worker who 'groomed toddlers' to lose Working with Children Check

image.altText: A man stands on a busy market street with a looming coal plant's cooling towers in the background.

props.synopsis: China has put its economic might behind renewable technologies in a desire to stop relying on imported fossil fuels.

title.children: China's green energy boom could spell the end of the fossil fuel age

image.altText: The exterior of a Commonwealth Bank branchm including the brand's logos.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has slipped from its record high as Commonwealth Bank reports a $10.1 billion annual profit. Wall Street breaks new records after the latest US inflation data reveals Donald Trump's tariffs have not resulted in much higher consumer prices yet. Follow live.

title.children: CBA shares slump despite bumper profit, dragging down ASX

image.altText: Maroubra Housing

props.synopsis: Australia is now a "home owner's welfare state", leading economists argue, and if the tax treatment of housing were reformed, the nation as a whole would benefit.

title.children: Australia is a 'home owners' welfare state'. Taxing the family home may be the answer

image.altText: Woman in AFP uniform around plants

props.synopsis: A police operation is underway at Sydney Airport after an officer's firearm was discharged during an arrest inside a domestic terminal this morning.

title.children: Man arrested after police gun fired at Sydney Airport

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Palestine Presser

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says he is seeking "big reform" from next week's productivity round table but "low-hanging fruit" will be the priority. Follow live.

title.children: 'Low-hanging fruit' in government's sights ahead of round table

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Government's response to algal bloom 'woefully inadequate'
Algal bloom more like a 'drought': Watt
Albanese says he's 'up for big reform'

image.altText: Graphics image of officer wearing uniform wearing a face mask and behind him a police vehicle and flag with the blue line in it

props.synopsis: The former police supervisor of Zachary Rolfe publicly displayed a symbol linked to far-right extremist groups on his Facebook page until last week, when the ABC notified his bosses.

title.children: Police officer with 'racist attitudes' displayed symbol linked to white supremacists

image.altText: A large billboard with Russian writing on it is seen near a local road on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: You don't have to look far in Russia to find hypotheses as to why Alaska is in the wrong hands. Whether Moscow could ever rule it again depends on who you talk to.

title.children: To understand Russia's 'Alaska myth', there's a song that could help

image.altText: Kitchen worker uses tongs in a pub kitchen in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The peak union group says a shorter work week would improve productivity and reduce burnout, adding workers should also be able to share in the spoils of the expected artificial intelligence boom.

title.children: Peak union body calls for four-day work week

image.altText: James Crisp x

props.synopsis: A father and son were accused of preying on victims at a Catholic boarding school but only one was charged.  Now they are both behind bars.

title.children: Father and son jailed decades after role in alleged school paedophile ring

image.altText: An image of a man with glasses and grey hair inset against an emergency department sign and a hospital building.

props.synopsis: A coroner rules a dementia patient who disappeared from a regional Queensland hospital in 2023, never to be seen again, died from dehydration. It prompted security changes, but did not stop similar incidents.

title.children: Dementia patient walks out of hospital never to be seen again

image.altText: A crowd of people surround a truck, some are climbing on the truck.

props.synopsis: A joint statement, signed by Foreign Minister Penny Wong, condemns the politicisation of aid and says "urgent action is needed now to halt and reverse starvation" in Gaza.

title.children: Australia and allies say Gaza's aid crisis has reached 'unimaginable levels'

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with long brown hair in a cream shirt, smiling with closed lips.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with two counts of murder after police found the bodies of Athena Georgopoulos and Andrew Gunn in a unit in Melbourne's south-east on Monday night.

title.children: Man charged over deaths of man and woman in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: The entrance of the El Caballo theme park.

props.synopsis: Millions of dollars were lost in a failed bid to transform the aging El Caballo equine resort on Perth's outskirts into homelessness accommodation for WA's Noongar community, an investigation finds.

title.children: Indigenous trust loses millions in failed horse ranch social housing plan

image.altText: A man sitting in hotel smiling

props.synopsis: Iranian-American comedy veteran Maz Jobrani believes the US president is trying to censor free speech in the United States, and he intends to hit back.

title.children: 'The emperor has no clothes': Comedian Maz Jobrani hits back at Trump

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: An Indigenous elder calls on the government to take more action on SA's toxic algal bloom as Environment Minister Murray Watt and Opposition Leader Sussan Ley both visit the state.

title.children: SA's algal bloom devastation like watching 'Uluru being destroyed'

image.altText: A dark coloured pig in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A pig control program in a known West Australian problem area has killed 12,000 pigs in six months, leaving farmers and experts stunned.

title.children: Record pig kill shocks farmers struggling with damage from pest

image.altText: Piles of timber and brick waste on a blank piece of land in the Mallee. The dirt is dry and brown with a few green shrubs.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide demolition company and its director are found guilty of illegally dumping thousands of tonnes of asbestos-contaminated waste.

title.children: Demolition firm ordered to pay $700k for illegally dumping asbestos

image.altText: A sandstone cliff line landslide with rocks at the bottom.

props.synopsis: One of the largest Blue Mountains rockfalls in recent years shaves off two notorious climbing routes that were never repeated after the first climbers established them.

title.children: Carne Wall landslide wipes out notoriously difficult Blue Mountains climb

image.altText: Wooden structure hangs off a sand dune near the ocean.

props.synopsis: It was an "iconic" site for marriage proposals, photos and sunset views, but erosion left the Lancelin lookout in Western Australia at risk of crumbling into the ocean.

title.children: Local governments battle coastal erosion as structures crumble

image.altText: a brown horse side on

props.synopsis: A rare neurological form of equine herpesvirus that can cause pregnant mares to abort foals is detected around Townsville and Toowoomba.

title.children: Rare horse virus found in two Queensland regions

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump. He his tilting his head and looking ahead with a slight frown.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has announced a federal takeover of Washington DC's police force, saying the city is "becoming a situation of complete and total lawlessness". But is this true?

title.children: 'Violent gangs and bloodthirsty criminals': Is crime rising in Washington DC?

image.altText: A very large dead great white shark found on a beach in Louth Bay.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 5-metre great white shark missing its jaws is labelled "bizarre and worrying" by an illegal animal trade expert.

title.children: Great white shark found with missing jaws sparks illegal trade concerns

image.altText: A man poses in a photo.

props.synopsis: A man was set to receive $12,000 for directing an arson attack on a Jewish business in Sydney's east last year, court documents allege.

title.children: Court documents allege $12k payment for arson attack in Jewish business

image.altText: Dewald Brevis walks off the field carrying his bat and his helmet

props.synopsis: Emerging star Dewald Brevis smashes a record 125 not out in 56 balls to set up a 53-run victory for South Africa and level the T20 series with Australia.

title.children: South Africa's next great batting hope blows Australia away with record T20 knock

image.altText: GettyImages-97340442

props.synopsis: It was a season that would go down in history as one of the great AFL performances. Now, the five men who played for the Blues for the first time in 1995 tell their stories of that incredible year.

title.children: How five debuts help tell the story of Carlton's remarkable 1995 season

image.altText: Kim Keon Hee dressed in black

props.synopsis: Investigators seek to charge Kim Keon Hee over various suspected crimes, including bribery, stock manipulation and meddling in the selection of a candidate.

title.children: South Korean court orders arrest of jailed ex-president's wife

image.altText: man in black top standing in front of brick wall behind bar

props.synopsis: A business owner who spent $40,000 connecting to natural gas last year now faces a $20,000 bill to convert to electric, before Solstice Energy shuts the gas network in his town.

title.children: Residents hit with 'poorly planned' gas shutdown ask for compensation

image.altText: Small blocks of cheese labelled Pyengana Dairy sit on a supermarket sheft.

props.synopsis: After selling Betta Milk, Meander Valley Dairy and Shima Wasabi, another Tasmanian brand is being sold off by TasFoods.

title.children: Pyengana Dairy the latest on the TasFoods chopping block

image.altText: Archie Wilson crying during a press conference for University of Nebraska.

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Archie Wilson, who is chasing a dream of being a punter in American football, has broken down while discussing living away from his family.

title.children: Homesickness takes toll on Australian chasing American football dream

image.altText: Tasmanian Greens Member Rosalie Woodruff 2025-05-27 10:05:00

props.synopsis: Like in the AFL, Tasmanian politics is in its own trade week — and at the moment, the protracted negotiations are between Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Tasmanian Labor have so far failed to sway the Greens, and it's blown up on them

image.altText: A woman fills out a ballot.

props.synopsis: Five months on from Western Australia's problem-plagued state election, organisers have been given a clear road map to avoid the same mistakes in four years' time.

title.children: How a $12 million shortfall spiralled into a problem-plagued WA election

image.altText: A woman wearing a teal headdress is crying with tears rolling from her eyes

props.synopsis: The Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar said victims were subject to beatings, electric shocks, sexual violence, strangulation and other forms of torture.

title.children: Children illegally detained, tortured in Myanmar, UN investigator finds

image.altText: Woman poses for photo, leaning against a black fence at a racecourse

props.synopsis: The announcement of funding being ended for Tasmania's greyhound racing industry has left the people who work in it "filthy, angry", a trainer says — with special mention made of the Liberal state premier.

title.children: Greyhound industry 'filthy and angry' over Tasmanian ban
